intro: Semele menezesii, commonly known as the Menezes's flamecup, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from orange to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Semele menezesii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral morphology.
